page.title: 13POLICING OF THE MOORLANDS
page.content: 1.FIRES-The police's role at a moorland fire is to close any roads that are threatened by fire or by smoke. To evacuate farms and cottages if necessary.Stolen cars are occasionally ignited and the owner of the vehicle has to be traced and the fire brigade alerted. 2.TRAPPED DOWN PITS-The area has many old workings and though most of the shafts have been capped people do occasionally get trapped down them.The police would liaise with the British Cave Rescue in the rescue attempt. 3.MAJOR DISASTER-For example if an aeroplane crashed on the moors.The police work under a set plan.They alert Rochdale Infermary, obtain back up from North Manchester, Bury and Oldham Police forces and if at night erect portable floodlighting.A Central Casualty Bureau liaise with the public
